Author: Alyssa Abkowitz
Description: Chinese internet giant Tencent says it wants to improve the world through technology. David Wallerstein, its chief exploration officer, is on it.

Title: France’s Total Rewards Investors After Oil Downturn—Energy Journal
Author: Neanda Salvaterra
Description: Big Oil Rewards Investors Again

Title: Tesla's Elon Musk Regains Bravado
Author: Tim Higgins
Description: Three months ago, Tesla Chief Executive Elon Musk warned of the company’s production issues. On Wednesday, a day after his SpaceX rocket blasted into space, Mr. Musk was upbeat, again boldly predicting his company would make one million vehicles a year in 202…

Title: Tesla Can't Defy Gravity Forever
Author: Charley Grant
Description: Tesla doesn’t seem to be getting closer to profitability, even after record fourth-quarter deliveries.

Title: Tesla Posts Smaller-Than-Expected Loss, Touts Sale of More Than 100,000 Cars Last Year
Author: Tim Higgins
Description: Tesla reported a narrower fourth-quarter loss than expected, a promising sign that could ease some pressure on the electric car company as it tries to overcome months of production woes building its long-awaited Model 3 sedan.

Title: GOP Rep. Comstock Challenges Trump Over Shutdown Comment
Author: Joshua Jamerson
Description: News and analysis from WSJ's Washington bureau

Title: Tesla Earnings: What to Watch
Author: Tim Higgins
Description: Tesla is expected to release financial results after the market closes Wednesday. Investors are likely to focus on the car-maker’s growth strategy and spending plans.

Title: SpaceX Launches World's Biggest Rocket
Author: Andy Pasztor
Description: Space Exploration Technologies Corp. successfully launched the Falcon Heavy rocket on its initial test flight, marking another historic coup for founder Elon Musk.

Title: Space Exploration May Take Off in 2018
Author: Taylor Dinerman
Description: NASA and private companies move beyond Earth’s orbit.

Title: Why Women Are Rarely Serial Innovators
Author: Melissa Schilling
Description: A single-minded life of invention is hard to combine with family obligations. One solution: ‘nonlinear’ careers.

Title: New Falcon Heavy Rocket Represents a Major Bet for SpaceX
Author: Andy Pasztor
Description: Widely acknowledged as an engineering marvel, the giant new booster faces uncertain commercial demand. The rocket is set to make its maiden voyage on Tuesday.

Title: Tesla sells $546 million of bonds to raise cash for production ramp-up
Author: Sam Goldfarb , Ben Eisen
Description: Tesla Inc. sold $546 million of bonds backed by lease payments on Model X and Model S vehicles on Thursday, continuing its wide-ranging search for cash as it tries its ramp up production of its first mass-market car.

Title: GM Ramps Up Testing of Self-Driving Cars, But Still Lags Waymo
Author: Tim Higgins
Description: GM reported progress in the consistency of its autonomous-driving system last year as it sharply increased testing on the roads of California, though it remained well behind the self-driving tech unit of Google-parent Alphabet Inc., according to state records.

Title: Want the Scoop on Tesla's Model 3? That Will Cost You $500,000
Author: Tim Higgins
Description: A shortage of Model 3 sedans has created a frenzy among curious competitors, Tesla enthusiasts and auto reviewers to get their hands on the electric car. One engineering firm is buying cars from early buyers and selling data and CT scans to other auto makers.

Title: Amazon, Berkshire, JPMorgan to Partner on Health Care
Author: Cara Lombardo
Description: Amazon.com, Berkshire Hathaway and JPMorgan are forming a company to figure out how to reduce health-care costs for their hundreds of thousands of U.S. employees.

Title: The Wall Street Journal: Alibaba, Foxconn lead big investment in Chinese electric-car maker
Author: Liza Lin
Description: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. and Foxconn Technology Group have co-led a 2.2 billion yuan ($348 million) funding round into Chinese electric-vehicle manufacturer Xiaopeng Motors, marking Alibaba’s first big investment in a car maker

Title: Stocks to Watch: VMWare, Intel, Starbucks, Tesla, Nike, Western Digital, Honeywell, Rockwell Collins
Author: Amrith Ramkumar
Description: Among the companies with shares expected to trade actively in Friday's session are Dell Technologies, Intel, Starbucks, Tesla, Nike and Western Digital.

Title: Here's Where There Could Still Be Value in Global Stocks
Author: Nathaniel Taplin
Description: Stocks are expensive, but global factories are suddenly running very hot. Investors still looking for an entry point might want to take a look at the big beneficiaries.

Title: Is Broadcom's CEO, a Champion Deal Maker, Innovative Enough?
Author: Ted Greenwald
Description: Broadcom Chief Executive Hock Tan relishes his role as the chip industry’s most visible deal maker, but some customers and former employees worry he is skimping on research and innovation.

Title: Tesla Gives Elon Musk New 10-Year Pay-for-Performance Deal
Author: Tim Higgins
Description: Tesla unleashed a bold pay package for Chief Executive Elon Musk that again ties his compensation entirely to key performance benchmarks. This time, the goals take the electric-car maker to cosmic heights, including an ultimate aim of hitting $650 billion in …

Title: WSJ City PM: A Disney Solution to Sky, What’s Happening in Davos, Why Netflix Is Stealing the Show
Author: Mischa Frankl-Duval
Description: Good afternoon from the WSJ City desks in London. WSJ City is the app that delivers concise, smart news on business and finance for mobile. Download for iPhone or Android. Here’s essential reading on today’s developments. MUST READS FROM WSJ CITY Sky shares r…

Title: The Genius of Elon Musk’s New Compensation Plan
Author: Charley Grant
Description: New plan offers potential for big rewards, especially when you consider what's not included.

Title: Stocks to Watch: Netflix, J&J, Travelers, Tesla, JPMorgan Chase, Twitter, Apple, P&G, Verizon
Author: Amrith Ramkumar
Description: Among the companies with shares expected to trade actively in Tuesday's session are Netflix Inc., Johnson & Johnson, Travelers Cos., Tesla Inc., JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Twitter Inc.

Title: Tesla changes Elon Musk’s pay to tie it to market cap and other targets
Author: Tim Higgins
Description: The 10-year compensation plan ultimately aims for Tesla market cap of $650 billion.

Title: Tesla Gives Musk New Long-Term Pay Deal
Author: Tim Higgins
Description: Tesla said it updated the pay package for Elon Musk with a plan that again ties his compensation entirely to key performance benchmarks—albeit this time much larger ones.

Title: For These Entrepreneurs, Silicon Valley Is, Like, Lame
Author: Li Yuan
Description: A trip to Silicon Valley is something of a rite for ambitious Chinese startups and investors looking for inspiration in global tech’s mecca of innovation. But a visit last week failed to impress. Silicon Valley’s allure is fading.

Title: Ford Sees Lower Operating Profit on Earnings-per-Share Basis
Author: John D. Stoll
Description: Ford said it expects lower operating profit on an earnings-per-share basis in 2018, with higher commodity costs and adverse exchange rates offsetting gains from cost-cutting efforts and continued demand for high-margin pickup trucks.

Title: BMW Bets on Old-Fashioned Car Ownership
Author: Stephen Wilmot
Description: The German car maker has bought mobile-based parking vendor Parkmobile

Title: You're Stuck With Batteries---But New Tech Will Make Them Last Longer
Author: Joanna Stern
Description: While batteries seem to be moving at a slower clip than other tech development, products and concepts on display at the annual CES trade show address some of our biggest power problems.

Title: The Three Stumbling Blocks to a Solar-Powered Nation
Author: Christopher Mims
Description: Solar energy is growing at a faster rate world-wide than any other source—but existing technology has its limits and R&D is lacking.

Title: NASA safety watchdogs raise concern about SpaceX, Boeing spacecraft
Author: Andy Pasztor
Description: NASA’s plan to routinely ferry astronauts into orbit using private spacecraft—initially slated to start last year—has now slipped until at least the spring of 2019 and unresolved hazards threaten further delays.

Title: Tencent Joins Asia-Tech Debt Rush With Its Biggest Bond Sale
Author: Manju Dalal
Description: Chinese internet giant Tencent Holdings Ltd.’s visit to the bond market this week marked the latest in a string of Asian technology firms that have been issuing more debt as their market values have swelled.
